sentences.en: A leather sofa will usually outlast a cloth one.
sentences.cn: 皮沙发一般要比布沙发耐用。

sentences.en: Even those leafless beech trees would outlast him.
sentences.cn: 甚至那些光秃秃的山毛榉树也会比他活得长久.

sentences.en: He can outlast anyone on the dance floor.
sentences.cn: 在舞场上，他比谁都能跳。

sentences.en: Most sealants are acrylic polymer formulas that outshine and outlast the most expensive waxes.
sentences.cn: 多数密封胶是丙烯酸聚合体,比昂贵的蜡还要闪亮,耐久.

sentences.en: Smith outlasted his rivals in the council to become leader in 1996.
sentences.cn: 史密斯比对手坚持得更久，于1996年成了委员会的领导人。

sentences.en: The best buildings are often so well constructed that they outlast their original use.
sentences.cn: 最佳的建筑常常建筑得很好,在超出了设计使用期后依然巍峨屹立.

sentences.en: The gold standard failed to outlast the Depression.
sentences.cn: 金平价未能在经济萧条时期得已持续.

sentences.en: The great use of life is to spend it doing something that will outlast it.
sentences.cn: 人生的充分利用就是为争取比人生更长久的东西而度过一生。

sentences.en: These naturally dried flowers will outlast a bouquet of fresh blooms.
sentences.cn: 这些自然风干的花会比一束鲜花更加持久。

sentences.en: This kind of fine - grain substance is designed to outlast ordinary leather.
sentences.cn: 这种细纹理材料设计得要比普通皮革更耐用.

trans.tran_en: to continue to exist or be effective for a longer time than something else
